results.title: ‘Air’ Review: The Game Changers
results.abstract: In Ben Affleck’s enjoyable movie, Matt Damon stars as the Nike exec who’s trying to sign a young Michael Jordan. But first he must contend with Viola Davis.

multimedia.caption: Matt Damon as a Nike exec and Viola Davis as Michael Jordan’s formidable mother in “Air.”
Matt Damon as a Nike exec and Viola Davis as Michael Jordan’s formidable mother in “Air.”

results.title: ‘Showing Up’ Review: Making Art in All Its Everyday Glory
results.abstract: In their latest movie together, Michelle Williams and Kelly Reichardt paint a portrait of an artist who’s a real and wonderful piece of work.

multimedia.caption: Michelle Williams, as a sculptor in “Showing Up,” is revelatory and pointedly de-glammed.
Michelle Williams, as a sculptor in “Showing Up,” is revelatory and pointedly de-glammed.
Michelle Williams, as a sculptor in “Showing Up,” is revelatory and pointedly de-glammed.

results.title: ‘The Super Mario Bros. Movie’ Review: This Ain’t No Game
results.abstract: A famed video game character side-scrolls once again to the big screen in this bland, witless and flagrantly pandering animated comedy.

results.abstract: A book that proposed violent action in response to the climate crisis becomes a propulsive heist thriller.

results.title: Air Jordans on the Big Screen: When the Sneaker Is the Real Star
results.abstract: “Air” tells the origin story of the iconic brand, but it’s long had a hold on Hollywood, from “Do the Right Thing” to “Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse.”

multimedia.caption: Matt Damon as the Nike marketer Sonny Vaccaro in “Air,” about the creation of the Michael Jordan shoe.
Matt Damon as the Nike marketer Sonny Vaccaro in “Air,” about the creation of the Michael Jordan shoe.
Matt Damon as the Nike marketer Sonny Vaccaro in “Air,” about the creation of the Michael Jordan shoe.

results.title: ‘Joyland’ Review: A Target of Gossip
results.abstract: Saim Sadiq’s melodrama, about a husband’s affair with a transgender dancer, was briefly banned in Pakistan.

multimedia.caption: Ali Junejo, left, and Alina Khan in “Joyland,” which has a subtle metaphor for how society constrains the colorful shades of human desire.

results.title: ‘Paint’ Review: Watch It Dry
results.abstract: Owen Wilson plays a Bob Ross-inspired painter in this dated, mildly amusing parody of male privilege.

results.title: ‘Praise This’ Review: An Unlikely Savior

results.title: ‘Pretty Baby: Brooke Shields’ Review: Girlhood, Interrupted
results.abstract: Lana Wilson’s documentary blossoms in moments of cultural commentary, where it builds a mood of reminiscence gone rancid.

results.title: Hoping to Draw Moviegoers and Filmmakers, Amazon Heads to Theaters
results.abstract: The streaming company released Ben Affleck’s “Air” on 3,500 movie screens this week, and it plans to open 10 to 12 films theatrically every year.

multimedia.caption: “I felt like Charlie Brown with a football,” Ben Affleck said of the thought that the movie “Air,” which he directed and stars in, wouldn’t play in theaters.
“I felt like Charlie Brown with a football,” Ben Affleck said of the thought that the movie “Air,” which he directed and stars in, wouldn’t play in theaters.

results.title: The Dog Days of Michaela Watkins
results.abstract: The star of “Paint” contemplates work, canines, a coyote attack and mortality while bouncing between the coasts.
des_facet: History of the World, Part II (TV Program)

results.title: An L.G.B.T. Pakistani Film, Banned at Home, Is Celebrated Abroad
results.abstract: Saim Sadiq’s feature “Joyland,” which includes a transgender woman’s love affair, cannot be shown in Pakistan’s Punjab Province.

results.title: In 1993 ‘Super Mario Bros.’ Bombed; in 2023, It’s a Hit With a New Generation
results.abstract: A critical and commercial disaster in its day, the video-game adaptation was trashed even by its star, Bob Hoskins. But a reappraisal is underway.

results.abstract: A family receives impromptu flight lessons when their pilot dies in the middle of a chartered flight in this spiritually insincere action film.

results.title: ‘I’ve Lost a Lot of Flesh and Bone,’ Jeremy Renner Says, Recalling Snow Plow Accident
results.abstract: The actor, who sustained more than 30 broken bones when a 14,000-pound plow ran him over in January, described his arduous recovery in an interview with ABC News.

multimedia.caption: Jeremy Renner, who was severely injured when a heavy snow plow ran over him, said that he had been trying to save his nephew when the accident occurred.
Jeremy Renner, who was severely injured when a heavy snow plow ran over him, said that he had been trying to save his nephew when the accident occurred.

results.title: ‘Ride On’ Review: Jackie Chan, Back on the Horse

results.title: Johnny Depp Film About Louis XV Will Open Cannes Film Festival

results.title: ‘Hot Ones’ Was a Slow Burn All Along
results.abstract: This YouTube talk show’s premise is simple: Disarm celebrities with deep-cut questions and scorchingly spicy wings. Nearly 300 episodes later, the recipe still works.

multimedia.caption: “We’ve lived through like four different new media generations,” said Sean Evans, the longtime host of “Hot Ones,” “and we’ve been able to ride those rocky waters, but just in like the smoothest way.”

results.title: Netflix’s Approach Shifts, Pushing Content That Can ‘Pop’
results.abstract: The streaming service long thought spending on ads didn’t result in more viewers. That has subtly changed under the marketing chief Marian Lee.

results.title: Ryuichi Sakamoto, Oscar-Winning Composer, Dies at 71
results.abstract: Mr. Sakamoto, whose work with Yellow Magic Orchestra influenced electronic music, composed scores for “The Last Emperor” and “The Revenant.”

multimedia.caption: The composer Ryuichi Sakamoto in Manhattan in 2018. His music was catchy, emotive and deeply attuned to the sounds around him, and he won an Oscar, a Grammy and two Golden Globes.
multimedia.copyright: Nathan Bajar for The New York Times

results.title: How Cold War Politics Destroyed One of the Most Popular Bands in America
results.abstract: A new documentary chronicles the strange, intrigue-filled saga of Blood, Sweat & Tears and its disastrous Eastern Bloc tour in 1970.
des_facet: What the Hell Happened to Blood, Sweat & Tears? (Movie)

multimedia.caption: A planned movie of the tour fell apart as did a proposed TV special. The footage, smuggled out of the Eastern Bloc, was found in a vault.
A planned movie of the tour fell apart as did a proposed TV special. The footage, smuggled out of the Eastern Bloc, was found in a vault.

results.title: Adam Sandler Grows Up (Mostly)
results.abstract: At 56, the formerly juvenile funnyman has matured into a subtler, more nuanced comedy performer. It’s why the “Murder Mystery” films work so well.

multimedia.caption: Adam Sandler opposite Jennifer Aniston in “Murder Mystery 2.” Even in comic movies lately, the actor laces his performances with depth.
Adam Sandler opposite Jennifer Aniston in “Murder Mystery 2.” Even in comic movies lately, the actor laces his performances with depth.

results.title: Three Great Documentaries to Stream
results.abstract: This month’s picks include a film about a summer camp for the disabled, a portrait of a defense secretary’s regrets about the Vietnam War and one of the best sport documentaries of all time.
